description: Conversion of garage to habitable use, alterations to fenestration, removal of existing outbuildings and reduction in height of external chimney
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area.

Notwithstanding the details shown on submitted plans the rooflights to be installed to the flat roof shall be a conservation type roof-light and shall be of a colour to match that of existing fenestration to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority unless otherwise agreed in writing.
To preserve the character of the subject dwelling and wider Conservation Area.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent via email on 23.4.25. The revisions involved the change of the skylights to a flush design and the retention of a garage door.  Amended plans were subsequently submitted on 24.6.25.
